riddle: What number becomes zero when you subtract 15 from half of it?
I am a two-digit number. My tens digit is double my ones digit. The sum of my digits is 12. What number am I?
A farmer has 10 sheep. All but 3 run away. How many are left?
I am a number. Multiply me by 4, then subtract 6, and you get 18. What number am I?
What comes next in the sequence: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, __?
I am a number between 1 and 100. When divided by 3, my remainder is 2. When divided by 5, my remainder is 3. What number am I?
I am a three-digit number. My hundreds digit is 3 times my ones digit. My tens digit is the sum of my other two digits. What number am I?
A number is doubled and then increased by 8. The result is 20. What is the number?
I am a number that is half of 60 and also one-third of 90. What number am I?
What two numbers add up to 12 and multiply to 35?
I am a number that is the sum of the first four prime numbers. What number am I?
I am a square number between 20 and 30. What number am I?
I am a three-digit number. My digits add up to 9, and my ones digit is 3. My hundreds digit is twice my ones digit. What number am I?
I am a number that is a multiple of 9 and also a multiple of 12. The smallest such number is?
A father is three times as old as his son. In 12 years, he will be twice as old. How old is the son now?
I am a prime number greater than 10 and less than 20. My digits add up to 8. What number am I?
If you reverse my digits, I become 9 more than I was before. I am a two-digit number. What number am I?
A store sells apples in bags of 6. If you buy 5 bags, how many apples do you have?
I am a number whose square is 64. What number am I?
I am a number that, when divided by 4, gives a remainder of 3. I am also between 10 and 20. What number am I?
What is the next number in the pattern: 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, __?
I am a three-digit number. My tens digit is 5, my ones digit is twice my hundreds digit. The sum of my digits is 11. What number am I?
I am a number that, when added to 12, equals half of 36. What number am I?
If you take my square root and add 5, you get 14. What number am I?
I am an even number between 50 and 60 that is divisible by 7. What number am I?
I am a number that, when tripled and increased by 7, equals 40. What number am I?
I am a number between 20 and 30. When divided by 6, I give a remainder of 2. What number am I?
I am a two-digit number. My ones digit is 4 more than my tens digit. The sum of my digits is 10. What number am I?
I am a number that is the product of two prime numbers. I am between 10 and 20. What number am I?
I am a number whose cube is 64. What number am I?
